feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 10 at 10:01AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RESUSPENDED ASH FROM KATMAI-NOVARUPTA EXPECTED OVER KODIAK ISLAND THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... Strong northwesterly winds are beginning to diminish across Shelikof Strait this morning and will continue to decrease through this afternoon. These winds have resuspend ash from the 1912 Katmai-Novarupta eruption. The communities of Kodiak, Karluk and

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 10 at 4:27AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Periods of Snow and Blowing Snow Through Today... Snowfall and gusty winds between 15 and 25 mph will result in localized areas of blowing snow through this morning, with an additional 1 to 2 inches of snowfall accumulation expected through today. Roads may be slick and will be accompanied with blowing and drifting snow, so expect travel difficulties.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Dalton Highway Summits; South Slopes Of The Central Brooks Range; South Slopes Of The Eastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Yukon Flats

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 10 at 4:23AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow and Blowing Snow through Today... East winds of 15 to 20 mph are expected in areas along the Dalton Highway south of Prudhoe Bay. Accumulating snow of 2 to 4 inches through tonight, which when combined with wind will result in periods of blowing snow and reduced visibility. Use caution when traveling.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 10 at 4:23AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow and Blowing Snow through Today... East winds of 20 to 30 mph are expected near and south of Utqiagvik through today. Accumulating snow of 1 to 3 inches will accompany the winds.. This will result in periods of blowing snow and reduced visibility. Use caution when traveling.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 10 at 4:02AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WINDS POSSIBLE FOR THE EASTERN ALEUTIANS THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... A strong North Pacific low lifts into the Western Bering Sea by Wednesday. entry.summary: ...BLUSTERY SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST WINDS EXPECTED THROUGH WEDNESDAY... A potent autumn Pacific frontal system is moving onshore this morning, spreading light to moderate rain across southwest Washington and northwest Oregon. While strong winds associated with this system have thus far remained offshore, south winds are beginning to increase along the coast and will eventually spread

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued October 10 at 2:50AM MDT until October 13 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG FALL STORM MAY BRING HEAVY SNOWFALL TO PORTIONS OF THE BLACK HILLS THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY... .A strong fall storm will develop over the Plains late Wednesday into Thursday, bringing heavy precipitation and strong winds to our area through early Friday. Precipitation will begin as rain, with some thunderstorms expected Wednesday into Wednesday night.
